summary: Eswatini, formerly known as Swaziland, is a small landlocked country in Southern Africa, bordered by Mozambique and South Africa. It's diverse in climate and terrain, with mountains and a dry low-lying area. The Swazi people are the main ethnic group, and their language is Swati. The country was named after King Mswati II, who expanded and unified it in the 19th century. It gained independence from Britain in 1968. Eswatini has a unique absolute monarchy government, led by King Mswati III. The economy relies on agriculture and manufacturing, and it trades mostly with South Africa, the US, and the EU.
title: Eswatini
